user.title: EV Smart Charger Setup
user.description: This wizard will guide you through setting up your EV Smart Charger.

charger.title: 1. Charger Setup
charger.description: Configure your Zaptec charger entities. The **Switch** is the preferred control method.

data_description.zaptec_current_limiter: The entity that controls the maximum charging current (Amps).
data_description.zaptec_switch: The main On/Off switch for the charger (Recommended). If set, buttons are ignored.
data_description.zaptec_resume_button: Fallback: Entity to START charging if no switch is available.
data_description.zaptec_stop_button: Fallback: Entity to STOP charging if no switch is available.

car.title: 2. Car Setup
car.description:
Configure Car sensors and integration services.

**Advanced Control:** If your car integration supports services to set charge limits or force updates (like Kia/Hyundai), configure them here.

data_description.car_soc_sensor: Sensor indicating the current battery percentage of the car.
data_description.car_plugged_sensor: Binary sensor indicating if the charging cable is connected.
data_description.car_capacity: The total usable battery capacity of your EV.
data_description.car_charging_level_entity: Simple method: Entity to set the charge limit (e.g. number.kona_charge_limit).
data_description.car_entity_id: The Vehicle Device (or Entity) to target for the services below.
data_description.car_limit_service: Optional: Service name to set limits (e.g. 'kia_uvo.set_charge_limits'). Uses the Vehicle Entity above.
data_description.car_refresh_action: Optional: Service name to force data update (e.g. 'kia_uvo.force_update'). Uses the Vehicle Entity above.
data_description.car_refresh_interval: How often to force a refresh while plugged in.

meter.title: 3. Electricity Meter
meter.description: Configure your P1 meter sensors and Main Fuse size.

data_description.p1_l1_sensor: Real-time current (Amps) on Phase 1 from your main meter.
data_description.p1_l2_sensor: Real-time current (Amps) on Phase 2 from your main meter.
data_description.p1_l3_sensor: Real-time current (Amps) on Phase 3 from your main meter.
data_description.charger_current_l1: Optional: Specific current usage of the charger (L1). Helps calculate net house load.
data_description.charger_current_l2: Optional: Specific current usage of the charger (L2).
data_description.charger_current_l3: Optional: Specific current usage of the charger (L3).
data_description.max_fuse: The size of your main household fuse (Amps) to prevent tripping.

price_calendar.title: 4. Price & Calendar
price_calendar.description: Configure Electricity Prices and Calendar integration.

data_description.price_sensor: Optional: Nordpool sensor for spot prices. If empty, runs in simple Load Balancing mode.
data_description.calendar_entity: Optional: Local Calendar to read for departure times and target SoC (e.g. 'Trip 90%').
data_description.charger_loss: Optional: Starting estimate for energy loss (0-20%). Will auto-adjust if Smart Refresh is enabled. Leave at 0% to learn from scratch.
data_description.currency: Currency symbol to display in cost summaries.

planning.title: 5. Planning & Defaults
planning.description: Set your standard charging schedule and price thresholds.

data_description.departure_time: Your typical daily departure time (e.g., 07:00 for morning commute).
data_description.target_soc: Default charging target when you plug in (typically 80%).
data_description.min_guaranteed_soc: Minimum SoC to maintain regardless of price (safety buffer).
data_description.price_limit_1: Nordpool price threshold for 'very cheap' electricity (before taxes). When spot price is below this, charge opportunistically.
data_description.target_soc_1: Target SoC when prices are very cheap (typically 90-100% to take advantage).
data_description.price_limit_2: Nordpool price threshold for 'acceptable' electricity (before taxes). Charge to this target when prices are moderate.
data_description.target_soc_2: Target SoC when prices are acceptable (typically 70-80%).
